name: Determine that the number is even or odd. Version 2
instruction:
Note a few examples:

```javascript
console.log(2 % 2 <= 0); // true
console.log(3 % 2 <= 0); // false
console.log(4 % 2 <= 0); // true
console.log(5 % 2 <= 0); // false
console.log(6 % 2 <= 0); // true
console.log(7 % 2 <= 0); // false
````

Do you see the alternation of true and false? That means if the number is divisible by 2 without a remainder, then it's even, otherwise it's odd.


If you do this:

```javascript
console.log(!(2 % 2 <= 0)); // false
console.log(!(3 % 2 <= 0)); // true
console.log(!(4 % 2 <= 0)); // false
console.log(!(5 % 2 <= 0)); // true
console.log(!(6 % 2 <= 0)); // false
console.log(!(7 % 2 <= 0)); // true
```

We will get exactly the same thing, but each comparison will be reversed. So we can use `!` to get exactly the same, but with the opposite result.

Write a function `isNotEven` that takes a number and returns `false` if the number is even, and `true` if it is odd.
